front.title: Simple Reed-Solomon Forward Error Correction (FEC) Scheme for FECFRAME

abstract.t: This document describes a fully-specified simple FEC scheme for Reed-Solomon codes over GF(2^^m), with 2 <= m <= 16, that can be used toprotect arbitrary media streams along the lines defined by theFECFRAME framework. Reed-Solomon codes belong to the class ofMaximum Distance Separable (MDS) codes which means they offer optimalprotection against packet erasures. They are also systematic codes,which means that the source symbols are part of the encoding symbols.The price to pay is a limit on the maximum source block size, on themaximum number of encoding symbols, and a computational complexityhigher than that of LDPC codes for instance.
